text: selfies are great but the front-facing
cameras on smartphones are terrible when
are we going to get better selfie cams
and until we do which phone has the best
one
I'm Molly Wood from the New York Times
and I have with me arguably the four
best camera phones in the US market but
not one of them has a front facing
camera better than 2.1 megapixels so I
decided to take all four out and test
them to see which could produce the best
selfie and what better location than New
York City's Times Square
first up the iphone 5s now the
front-facing camera on this phone is
just 1 point 2 megapixels which is
basically nothing but megapixels aren't
everything the sensor and the optics
make a big difference in how the camera
actually performs now this is the nokia
lumia 1020 arguably the best camera
phone in the world this hunker on the
back is 41 megapixels with the front
facing camera is just 1.2 here we have
the samsung galaxy s4 2 megapixels on
the front facing camera which is getting
better although generally I've been
disappointed with s4 pictures so we'll
see now finally we have the HTC One and
HTC has made a big deal about both
cameras the front facing camera is 2.1
megapixel is the best of the bunch I
have high hopes
so I've spent some time scrolling
through my selfies and I have to say the
big surprise here is that I'm not very
impressed with the iphone front-facing
camera it's such a good rear camera but
the selfies overall very inconsistent I
think the best performer here is the HTC
One consistently good color good focus
and just nice photos overall followed I
think by the Nokia Lumia 1020 right now
the reason that most of these phones
only have one good camera is size you
can see what happens when you put a big
high megapixel camera with a lot of
sensors and optics in it gets a lot
better the phones are getting bigger and
I think I would rather have better
selfie cam than some super skinny phone
that makes me look bad so it's like duck
face its carapace
duckface therapy
